preamble.title: 1. Preamble
preamble.content: This Privacy Policy informs you about the nature, scope, and purpose of the processing of personal data in the mobile application "Freifahren" (hereinafter referred to as "App"). The App allows users to report incidents in public transport and share this information with other users. Additionally, reports are generated by the non-deterministic and anonymized evaluation of messages from the Freifahren_BE Telegram group.

responsible.title: 2. Responsible Party
responsible.content: The party responsible for data processing within this App is Freifahren GbR, represented by its partners, reachable via email at: johan@trieloff.net.

legalBasis.title: 3. Legal Basis for Data Processing
legalBasis.content: The processing of personal data in our App is based on the following legal grounds in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR):
legalBasis.consent: Consent (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. a GDPR): Users of our App provide their explicit consent for the processing of their personal data for specific purposes. This consent can be revoked at any time, whereby the revocation does not affect the legality of the processing carried out up to that point.
legalBasis.contract: Contractual performance and pre-contractual measures (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. b GDPR): Processing is necessary for the performance of a contract to which the data subject is a party or to take steps at the request of the data subject prior to entering into a contract.
legalBasis.legitimateInterest: Legitimate interests (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR): Processing is necessary to protect the legitimate interests of the controller or a third party, provided these interests are not overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the data subject.

dataUsage.title: 4. Data Collection and Usage
dataUsage.content: The App collects the following data when a report is submitted:
dataUsage.purpose: The reported data is temporarily made available to other users of the App to provide them with information about the current situation in public transport. Additionally, the information is forwarded to the Freifahren_BE Telegram group. This data transmission serves the purpose of sharing and informing the community about incidents.

anonymity.title: 5. Anonymity
anonymity.content: No personal data of users is stored. The reports are anonymous, and no conclusions can be drawn about individual persons.

storageAndAccess.title: 6. Storage and Access
storageAndAccess.content: The collected data is stored on our servers, hosted by Hetzner Online GmbH in Germany. The storage duration of the data is indefinite. The time taken by the user to submit a report is also stored on these servers. Access to the data is strictly limited to the partners of Freifahren GbR.

userRights.title: 7. User Rights
userRights.content: Users have the right to request information about their personal data, as well as to request the correction or deletion of such data. Requests can be submitted via the App's contact form or directly by email to johan@trieloff.net

consent.title: 8. Consent to the Privacy Policy
consent.content: Users must agree to this Privacy Policy before submitting a report in the App. This consent is a prerequisite for using the App.

dataProtectionOfficer.title: 9. Data Protection Officer
dataProtectionOfficer.content: For questions regarding data protection, please contact our Data Protection Officer, Johan Trieloff (johan@trieloff.net).

policyChanges.title: 10. Changes to the Privacy Policy
policyChanges.content: We reserve the right to change this Privacy Policy to reflect changes in legal conditions, the App, or data processing. Users are encouraged to regularly review the content of the Privacy Policy.

telegramMessages.title: 11. Processing of Telegram Messages
telegramMessages.content: Messages from the Freifahren_BE group are evaluated by the Freifahren Telegram Bot with the consent of the administrators. Messages are not stored and are only used for real-time evaluation. Only the non-deterministically extracted information (direction, line, and station) from the messages is stored. The timestamp is rounded to ensure anonymity.

analytics.title: 12. Use of Analytics Tools
analytics.content: We use the analytics software Pirsch Analytics in our App to capture general usage information, such as page views and session data. Pirsch Analytics is a cookie-free web analytics software designed according to the "Privacy by Design" principle...
dataPoints: Number of submitted reports and the time taken to submit a report, as well as other anonymized parameters.
Whether the risk line level was viewed.
Whether the list of reports was viewed.
Which marker (red dot) on the map was clicked.
Whether the user's location was shared and by which method.
How long it took to close the first window.
How the report form was used.
analytics.usage: These data are not personal; no information is collected that would allow user identification...

errorMonitoring.title: 13. Error Monitoring and Diagnostics
errorMonitoring.description: We use Sentry for error monitoring and crash reporting to maintain and improve our service. When the app encounters an error, we collect anonymized diagnostic information including:

dataPoints.state: App state at the time of the error

errorMonitoring.storage: This technical data is stored on Sentry's infrastructure located in the European Union for a maximum period of 30 days. We explicitly configure Sentry to not collect IP addresses. All data collection is anonymized and used solely for the purpose of identifying and fixing technical issues.

severabilityClause.title: 14. Severability Clause
severabilityClause.content: If any provision of this Privacy Policy is found to be wholly or partially invalid or unenforceable, or if it subsequently becomes invalid or unenforceable, the validity of the remaining provisions shall not be affected...
